Pronouns - As a Nominal Phrase Pronouns of all types normally stand alone in the place of an entire nominal phrase, but they can also be modified by a relative clause. In some languages pronouns may be modified by partitive phrases, and other languages allow pronouns to also be modified by and wide scope quantifiers and degree words. English examples of this type include the following:
just we three only he only these
In fewer languages, pronouns can also be modified by adjectives and possessors, acting just like nouns.
